qas.question: What is another term used for Special Education Services?
When were public schools become more and more developed?
What are some examples of alternative schools?

answers.text: Montessori schools, Waldorf schools (or Steiner schools), Friends schools

qas.question: What is not another term used for Special Education Services?

plausible_answers.text: Montessori schools, Waldorf schools (or Steiner schools), Friends schools

qas.question: What aren't some examples of alternative schools?
A charter school is not considered what type of school?
What hasn't gained importance in public education?

context: While considered "<a0_0><b3_0>alternative<b3_0/><a0_0/>" today, most alternative systems have existed since ancient times. After the public school system was widely developed beginning in the <a1_0>19th century<a1_0/>, some parents found reasons to be discontented with the new system. Alternative education developed in part as a reaction to perceived limitations and failings of traditional education. A broad range of educational approaches emerged, including alternative schools, self learning, homeschooling and unschooling. Example alternative schools include <a2_0><b4_0>Montessori schools, Waldorf schools (or Steiner schools), Friends schools<b4_0/><a2_0/>, Sands School, Summerhill School, The Peepal Grove School, Sudbury Valley School, Krishnamurti schools, and open classroom schools. <b6_0>Charter schools<b6_0/> are another example of <b5_0>alternative<b5_0/> education, which have in the recent years grown in numbers in the US and gained greater importance in its public education system.
